page.title: 02PATHHEAD:ITS LOCATION
page.content: { { { THE VILLAGE OF PATHHEAD IS SITUATED ON THE MAIN A68 ROAD,20KM SOUTH OF EDINBURGH.THE VILLAGE CONSISTS OF SOME 360 HOUSES, SOME OF WHICH DATE BACK TO THE 16th.CENTURY.THE MAIN STREET (WHICH CONSISTS OF MAINLY OLD HOUSES) BISECTS THE VILLAGE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH.THE REMAINING HOUSES WHICH LIE TO THE WEST OF THE VILLAGE ARE COUNCIL OWNED.THE VILLAGE IS SURROUNDED BY FARMLAND,WOODS AND PRIVATE ESTATES.SITUATED NEARBY IS CRICHTON CASTLE,PRESTON HALL,VOGRIE HOUSE AND OXENFOORD CASTLE.AT THE FOOT OF THE VILLAGE THE RIVER TYNE FLOWS IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION AND EMPTIES INTO THE RIVER FORTH.
